data.title: Brunswick zone
data.text: Bowling was fun especially for the kids , overall the place was clean , huge arcade for the kids, ordered pretzels which were warm and tasty. Would recommend for families, friends or even corporate events!

data.title: Fun..but expensive
data.text: They need to add more to the arcade and lower the prices. They need to make the bar smaller and make the arcade bigger.

data.title: Horrible first time
data.text: My first time here from Arkansas and it was a horrible experience. The staff was rude, including the manager on duty. We got overlooked for our services, and she shut down the arcade games on me. She should've let me finish. I even acknowledged her too. Never coming back.

data.title: Surprised by other reviews
data.text: I haven’t been bowling in forever when a coworker and her family asked me to go. I was impressed with the size of the facility; I wasn’t expecting it to be there. The employees were very friendly and engaging, anything we needed they were easy to find and quick to help. The lanes were pretty good and they had a good selection of rental shoe sizes and ball sizes. We ordered the sampler platter and everyone was very pleased. They were actually out of one of the items and showed excellent customer service by making up for it with something else that everyone liked. There is a lot of games for kids, and laser tag (which we did not get to do this time). On the game side, customer service wasn’t nearly as good but it was very clean. We had a great time, and will be back again the next time I am in town. The only drawback, as is in any facility like this, unsupervised teenagers who have been dropped of by their parents. They were no bad, but Management should keep an eye out that they do not run paying customers out.

data.title: Terrible customer service
data.text: Expensive and dirty! Terrible customer service when we had to deal with a damaged bowling ball by their equipment. Tried 3 times at the desk and with our food server to try and get the ball from behind the pins. It was left so long the ball was damaged by a belt. The Assisant manager was rude and unhelpful. Our party of 4 frequent bowlers will not be returning to this place. Go to Tuttles bowling alley in nearby Hopkins if you're looking for great customer service and a clean place. Food is better too.

data.title: Arcade, bowling, drinks
data.text: Came here for a date night with the boyfriend. Spent $40 each for an arcade card. Arcade was fun and we came home with neat prizes... It was spendy, but still kind of fun. When it was time to bowl we ordered a couple apps and didn't get our food until we were packing up to leave.  We went to the billiards room and had a couple drinks. The bartender Steve was super nice! It was really empty and dead so we left him a nice tip. My recommendation is just don't order food while bowling, you won't see it till you leave.

data.title: NASTY!!!!
data.text: this place was gross. this is not a place to take your kids or friends.if you love them. the staff was asked nicely three  times to clean up someone elses mess and by the time we finished our one and only game it was still not cleaned tables were dirty. i felt like i needed to take a shower when i left there. there were alot of police officers there and someone was being arrested.  from what i learned by being there the place has gone down hill since new ownership.enter the establishment at your own risk. disgusted overall.......

data.title: expensive
data.text: i had my daughter 13th b day  party there it was nice however costly....i guess she only turns 13 once

data.title: coolest bowling lanes
data.text: Went here on a Saturday night for all you can bowl. Great deal. Black lights. Fog machine. Couches at every lane. Service was great. Would definitely go again.

data.title: Good times with family
data.text:
Good place to hang out and have a few drinks. 
Wait time for the bowling alley is decent. BAR is awesome. Great stories happen there. Definelty recommend for family night outings, or group hang out.  Good place for kids too, I'm going to be doing a birthday party there next year for my daughter.

data.title: great to plan/reserve a birthday party at but other times expect a wait
data.text:
My husband planned a great surprise party for me here at Brunswick Zone XL.  We all, KIDS & ADULTS, had fun bowling for 2 hours my husband had reserved. Then after kids were taken home some of us adults hung out in the Adult only area to play pool & some drink.  

But some of other times that we have gone here without calling & reserve a lane ahead of time then the wait was soo long that we figured out something else to do.

data.title: Fun, but a wait.
data.text: Bowling prices, during the specials are a good deal. But be prepared to wait, as it is a popular place. It gets busy, and it can be hard to get a server for food or drinks, but they try their best. However, they are good at the bar, and they don't skimp on the drinks (like a few other bowling places I have been in the area). It's a good place to get away to, it's worth checking out if you haven't been there.

data.title: OK place to visit when nothing else going on.
data.text: Decent place to go bowling, play some arcade games and laser tag, and play billiards in the adults only den. Food seems overpriced for what you get. Not one area of the business provides outstanding service, not that great service is expected here, it just stood out that not one employee smiled or tried to up sell us on anything while there. Pricing seems stiff for what you get, but competitive to other bowling/arcade businesses.

data.title: Lots of family fun - if you don't mind a  crowd of inexperienced bowlers
data.text: Our family goes there on the weekends before noon to get in on the $0.99/games deal - but it is BUSY! And it is busy with many, many  people who don't know/understand/care about proper bowling etiquette. People don't wait their turn, kids and people stand on the lanes, families take over an entire table/bar area that is meant to be shared between the lanes. The staff is helpful enough when you call it to their attention, but if you're looking for some serious bowling - stick to your regular bowling alley.   Side Note: the bumper bowling and 6lb kids balls are great for little ones!
